children.subject: Woud it be doable to take 61B and 70 for Fall together and get a good grade?

It depends on the work you're willing to put in my friend. Think about how much effort you spent in 61A to get the grade you got and apply that to 61B and 70. I'd also suggest checking out past websites for 61B and 70 to see if you think the material will be easy to learn or high effort.

I think math 53 and stat 134 might be the most doable to take together during the summer (although I would recommend taking 140 instead) especially since you want to do extremely well in 61BL and 70 to declare

With respect to the grade distribution for 70 in the summer, it's generally more or less the same as the standard semester.  It only looks nicer because there are university-level policies that incentivize more people to drop the course late, so we have to account for that to ensure that the students who stay in the class aren't adversely affected.   But the tl;dr is that a student who performs the same in the summer versus spring/fall offering of the course should get the same letter grade.  (So the grade distribution looking nicer shouldn't play too much of a role in your overall decision.)
Recommend 53 + 61BL because 140 is great so you should take that, and I think 61BL workload < 70 workload

history.content:
hi  I'm trying to settle my Summer schedule and I need your advice for it.

I'm trying to double major in cs and stats, and for this Summer I have some options:

1. Take Math 53 and Stat 134(only last prerequisites for stat major but I've heard from many people that stat 140 is much better than 134)

2. Take Math 53 and 61BL

3. Take CS 70(it seems grade distribution is a bit better for Summer than regular semesters) and Math 53

Which option would you recommend? First option would force me to take 61B(Hug) and 70(Rao) together next Fall. Is it doable to take them concurrently?
history.subject: Summer Course Advice
